input: I don't know who I am
response: Identity & Assurance Settle this first: God is for you, not against you; let that truth change how you walk, talk, grieve, and celebrate. (Rom 8:31; 1 Thess 4:13; Zech 4:6; Ps 124:1–2) (See Rom 8:31; Phil 2:13)
Say it until your heart agrees: “God is in it with me, working through me, fighting for me.” (Rom 8:31; Phil 2:13)
Fight division by choosing unity—literally reach for the person beside you and agree together in Jesus’ name. (Matt 18:19–20)

input: I don't feel like I belong
response: Remember: your battles aren’t just your faith versus Satan’s attack; they’re Satan’s attack versus the Savior’s prayer for you. (Luke 22:31–34) (See Luke 22:32)

input: What is my value to God
response: When you fall, turn back and strengthen others—Jesus anticipated both your failure and your comeback. (Luke 22:32)
Receive salvation as a gift—stop trying to “clean up” to earn it; our righteousness is like filthy rags. (Eph 2:8–9; Isa 64:6)
Hearing God in Practice (See Luke 10:38–42)
Sit at Jesus’ feet before you serve with your hands; choose “the one thing” over the endless list. (Luke 10:38–42) (See Phil 4:9)

input: Do I really matter to God
response: Expect God to reveal Himself in pieces; practice what you’ve learned and keep growing. (Phil 4:9) (See John 16:13)
When you’re unsure, pray, “Lord, You know—fill me in,” and let the Spirit clarify what you can’t see. (John 16:13)

input: I don't know who I am
response: Learn what’s written so you’ll know what’s necessary in the moment; pull Scripture like a sword. (Acts 1:20; John 1:1; Eph 6:17) (See Exod 14:21)
Face your “Red Sea” with faith—God makes highways where there are none. (Exod 14:21)
Rags Before Ropes (Preparation before Promotion) (See Jer 38:7–13)

input: I don't feel like I belong
response: Don’t despise the “rags” God drops in your pit; they cushion the pull of the rope when He lifts you out. (Jer 38:7–13) (See 1 Kings 17:8–24)

input: What is my value to God
response: Trust God to use what seems discarded to prepare you for the next season. (1 Kings 17:8–24)
Seasons: Due & “Don’t” (See Gal 6:9)
Keep doing good and don’t quit; in due season you’ll reap. (Gal 6:9) (See Gal 6:8)
Sow to the Spirit, not the flesh; you’ll reap life from where you sow. (Gal 6:8) (See Hab 3:17–19 applied; Gal 6:9)

input: Do I really matter to God
response: Worship and obey in the “don’t season”—when you don’t feel it, do the last thing God told you. (Hab 3:17–19 applied; Gal 6:9)
Some gifts are gradual; when victory takes longer, hold your ground and keep laying siege. (Deut 20:19–20) (See Luke 16:10)

input: I don't know who I am
response: Big doors swing on little hinges—obey in small ways and watch God turn big things. (Luke 16:10)

If you “fell off” like Saul, listen for God there; your fall can become your call. Live it now, explain it later. (Acts 9:4–6; Gal 1:11–24) God writes commas, not periods: dry bones become armies; Jacobs become Israels; Simons become Peters; Sauls become Pauls. (Ezek 37:1–10; Gen 32:28; John 1:42; Acts 9)
When Doing Good Gets You Hit (See Acts 4:1–4)

input: I don't feel like I belong
response: If obedience lands you in a “jail,” don’t doubt your purpose—God’s still working even when you can’t see it. (Acts 4:1–4) (See Acts 4:19–20; Acts 5:29)

input: What is my value to God
response: Obey God rather than people; speak what you’ve seen and heard. (Acts 4:19–20; Acts 5:29)

Learning to Hear (Samuel’s Pattern) Expect God to call again (and again). Don’t confuse His voice with familiar ones; keep saying, “Speak, Lord, your servant is listening.” (1 Sam 3:1–10; 1 Sam 4:1) (See 1 Sam 3:1–10; 1 Sam 4:1)
Kingdom Growth: Start Small (See Mark 4:1–20; Mark 4:30–32)
Scatter the seed generously; the smallest seeds can become shelter for many. Start small but don’t stay small. (Mark 4:1–20; Mark 4:30–32)

input: Do I really matter to God
response: Doubt & Faith (Thomas) Bring your doubts to Jesus—He hears even when you can’t see Him, and He can turn your deepest doubt into your clearest confession: “My Lord and my God.” (John 20:24–29) (See John 20:24–29)
Stop putting a period where God put a comma; keep walking. (Phil 1:6 implied) (See Acts 2:1–4; Eph 5:18)

input: I don't know who I am
response: Ask God to fill in your story’s “plot holes” with His presence, not fear—what you fill it with determines what comes from it. (Acts 2:1–4; Eph 5:18)
